meanings.definition: Crumps (noun): small fragments of bread or cake
meanings.sent1: I sprinkled some crumps on top of the cupcake for decoration.
meanings.sent2: The birds pecked at the crumps left on the park bench.
meanings.sent3: The ants formed a line to carry away the crumps from the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The crumps of the cookie crumbled in my hand.
meanings.sent5: The crumps of the muffin added a delightful crunch to each bite.

meanings.definition: Crumps (verb): to make a crunching or crackling sound
meanings.sent1: As I stepped on the dry leaves, they crumps under my feet.
meanings.sent2: The fire crumps softly in the fireplace, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The old wooden floorboards crumps with every step, like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: The thunder crumps in the distance, signaling an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The cereal crumps loudly as milk is poured over it for breakfast.

meanings.definition: Crumps (adjective): describing something that is dry and brittle
meanings.sent1: The crumps leaves on the ground crackled when I walked on them.
meanings.sent2: The crumps toast was too hard to eat without butter.
meanings.sent3: The crumps branches snapped easily under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent4: The crumps soil in the garden needed water to become fertile again.
meanings.sent5: The crumps crackers were perfect for dipping in soup.
